long_desc.thetext:
Hello,
There's a new annoying bug (?) when handling virtual widgets. It seems affect Firefox 3.0.6 (I don't know for previous and beta versions or if it depends only of the Gecko version).
For instance, when a mouseover event is fired, the icons in the virtual tree are always refreshed. As this event occurs often (in fact everytime because there's a indicator bar that show the current branch that may be selected), it becomes really difficult to handle.
This strange effect seems to appear also with virtual tables.
Any ideas and/or workaround ?

What exactly is the strange behaviour? I've just opene the virtual tree demo <http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/demobrowser/#treevirtual~TreeVirtual.html> in my Firefox 3.0.6 (Mac) and everything looks OK.

Ok, I have to apologize. This strange behaviour seems to happen only in my windows xp (media center edition - but it's xp sp3 pro) computer. I tested it on Mac OS X, Ubuntu 8.10 and the problem just disappear. After what, I've tested it on another windows xp sp3 pro and this annoying problem didn't happen here too.
Maybe it's my micro$oft os that is just cr**p. One day, I'll format my computer to see if it happen again.
However, I leave a small video that shows what happen. I also added the gallery example where a selection of an icon makes all icons reload.
http://s1.qshare.com/get/812463/virtual-test.avi.html
Regards,
Benoît.
From the video it looks like you have turned off the browser cache.

You were right. In the about:config, it was indeed disabled.
Thanks a lot !
